newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatia's Kras plans 50 pct capital boost in 5 yrs.
newsitem.headline: Croatia's Kras plans 50 pct capital boost in 5 yrs.

text.p: Croatia's leading chocolate maker Kras plans to boost its equity by 271.5 million kuna or 50 percent within the next five years to aid the company's restructuring.
"For this, (Kras) will need fresh capital which, apart from credits can also be obtained through a capital increase," it said in a letter to shareholders, obtained by Reuters.
It will seek approval for this at the annual meeting on July 5, when its managing board is expected to be empowered to decide on concrete steps for raising new capital.
Kras said in the letter it envisaged raising money either with the help of investments in cash or goods, or through a possible new share issue, but there were no other details.
The confectioner has been negotiating for some time with the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) on a loan of an unspecified amount to expand its production.
It also said recently other parties were interested in investing in the company.
